title: the Health (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2021 (No. 24 of 2021)) of the Health Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Sections
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Sections 
31AB and 31AD) (Covid-19) (Operation of certain indoor premises) (No. 11) 
Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 20th day of 

December 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1947 (sections 31ab 31ad) (covid-19) (operation certain indoor premises) (no 11) regulation 2021 (2) regulation shall come operation 20th day december 2021

title: the Health (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2021 (No. 24 of 2021)) of the Health Act
heading: 2. In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1947
text_raw:
2. In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 1947 
(Sections 31AB and 31AD) (Covid-19) (Operation of certain indoor premises) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 385 of 2021).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean health act 1947 (sections 31ab 31ad) (covid-19) (operation certain indoor premises) regulation 2021 (s.i no 385 2021)

title: the Health (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2021 (No. 24 of 2021)) of the Health Act
heading: 3. Regulation 3(1B) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
3. Regulation 3(1B) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 

substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (a): 

“(a) 

the number of permitted persons allowed - 

(i) 

(ii) 

on a premises, prescribed by paragraph (a) of 
Regulation 2A, for the purposes of entertainment 
does not at any given time exceed the seating 
otherwise lawfully permitted in the premises at that 
time, and 

at a screening at an indoor cinema, being a premises 
prescribed by paragraph (b) of Regulation 2A, does 
not at any given time exceed 1,000 persons or 50 
percent of the seating otherwise lawfully permitted 
at that screening, whichever is the fewer;”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4. Regulation 5(3) of the Principal Regulations is amended, in the 

definition of “vaccinated person” - 

[737] 3 

(a) 

by the substitution, in subparagraph (f), of “administered to him 
or her,” for “administered to him or her, or”, 

(b) by 

the 

insertion of 

the 

following subparagraph after 

subparagraph (f): 

“(fa) in relation to a person to whom the medicinal product for 
active immunisation to prevent Covid-19 known as 
‘Bharat Biotech BBV152’, also known as ‘COVAXIN’, 
has been administered, that person not less than 14 days 
after the second dose of the medicinal product concerned 
has been administered to him or her, or”, 

(c) 

by the substitution, in subparagraph (g), of “paragraphs (a), (b), 
(c), (e), (f) and (fa)” for “paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (e) and (f)”, 

(d) by the substitution, in subparagraph (g)(iv), of “administered to 

him or her,” for “administered to him or her, or”, 

(e) 

(f) 

by the substitution, in subparagraph (g)(v), of “administered to 
him or her, or” for “administered to him or her.”, and 

in subparagraph (g), by the insertion of the following clause 
after clause (v): 

“(vi) in the case of the second dose being the medicinal product 
referred to in paragraph (fa), that person not less than 14 
days after the second dose of the medicinal product 
concerned has been administered to him or her.”. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [737] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

19 December, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [737] 5

title: the Health (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2021 (No. 24 of 2021)) of the Health Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend the operation of S.I 385 of 2021 (Operation of certain 
indoor premises) to provide for an amendment to the definition of vaccinated 
person and provide for capacity limits of 50% of venue capacity or 1,000 
attendees, whichever is the fewer, for cinemas. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [737]
